verbose_text: Upon vascular injury, tissue factor (TF) expressed from the damaged vasculature and TF bearing cells, such as monocytes, activate the initiation phase XREF_BIBR of the coagulation pathway by forming a complex with circulating factor VIIa (FVIIa) XREF_BIBR, resulting in the activation of factor X (FX) (See XREF_FIG for an illustration of the vascular endothelial cell layers, including coagulation factors and cells, and a summary of the results of this paper).
